content: january mittens specifications abbreviations yarn co = cast on bobble = bind off sport weight yarn such as novita nalle 285 yards / 100 g mc = main color in two colors approximately 50 g of each cc = contrasting color size sample mittens knitted to mitten circumference of 17 cm 6 ¾ inches women small for larger mittens increase the needle size and/or use thicker yarn for looser gauge needles suggested needles 2 5 mm us 1 5 and 3 0 mm us 2 5 gauge size small 17 cm / 6 ¾ 30 sts / 10 cm 4 on larger needles in stranded pattern blocked size medium 19 cm / 7 ½ 27 sts / 10 cm 4 on larger needles in stranded pattern blocked techniques provisional cast-on http //knitty com/issuefall05/featfall05tt html latvian braid http //ohdessaknits com/2010/07/17/latvian-braid-tutorial-and-other- such-stuff/ kitchener s stitch http //knitty com/issuesummer04/feattheresasum04 html yarn dominance if you know your stranded knitting to be affected by yarn dominance there are some recommendations in the pattern on how to take this into account otherwise you may end up with a slighlty muddled pattern especially if your color contrasts are subtle if you re not familiar with yarn dominance see for example http //www knittingdaily com/blogs/daily/archive/2013/07/22/understanding-yarn- dominance aspx or other online references i find that understanding about yarn dominance really makes a difference in my own stranded knitting instructions mitten using smaller needles and a piece of scrap yarn co 52 stitches with provisional cast-on using cc turn work knit one row and join in the round knit 11 row folded cuff on the next row fold the work in two so that the co stitches are behind the working stitches for each stitch on the needle pick up the corresponding stitch of the co edge place it on the left needle knitwise and k2tog so you ll be knitting together the stitch originally on the needle and the corresponding co stitch continue until the end of the row check occasionally that you haven t missed any co stitches along the way carefully remove the scrap yarn that passes through the co stitches next work the latvian braid starting with cc if you like you can work the braid left- leaning and right-leaning for the left and right hand mitten just change the order of the row where you twist the yarns to go over or under each other switch to larger needles before starting chart 1 note on yarn dominance on the first half of the stitches that will become the palm side of the mitten stitches 1-25 on chart 1 it s recommended that cc is the dominating color on the rest of the round stitches 26-52 it s recommended that mc is the dominating color so you d be switching the yarn orders in the middle knit row 1 35 of chart 1 on row 36 knit until you reach the stitches marking the thumb position the thumb is positioned differently in chart 1 for left
